dnimp
Class CMCRender

java.lang.Object
  dnimp.CMCRender

public class CMCRender
extends java.lang.Object

A member of the DNIMP package which handles relevant operations performed on a set of data.

CMCRender objects are optimized to read endpoints from CMC-formated back trajectory files, with each endpoint identified by the back-trajectory date. CMCRender reads correlated data and proceeds to perform additional steps in the World in order to write PSCF matrices, histograms and elevation plots to disk.

Constructor Detail

CMCRender

public CMCRender(int lon,
                 int lat,
                 double dX,
                 double dY,
                 java.lang.String inPathEndPoints,
                 java.lang.String concFilePath,
                 java.lang.String outDir)
          throws java.lang.Exception
Creates an instance of CMCRender with a World object of a given size and grid-dimensions.

Parameters:
lon - total longitude
lat - total latitude
dX - grid width in terms of latitude
dY - grid width in terms of longitude
inPathEndPoints - directory containing all CMC-formatted backtrajectories. NOTE: the directory must contain these files ONLY.
concFilePath - full path of the correlated data input file. The pathname must be absolute yet abstract.
outDir - program output directory. If the directory does not exist, it is created.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - IOExceptions and null pointer exceptions are thrown to higher levels. REQUIRES: Preconditions of lon,lat,dX and dY are given the World constructor. Directories and pathnames cannot be null and should exist.
Method Detail

readEP

public void readEP(int numCol,
                   boolean printElev,
                   javax.swing.JProgressBar progress)
            throws java.lang.Exception
Reads the endpoints from the CMC-formatted backtrajectories and adds them to the World object.

Parameters:
numCol - the number of columns in the CMC-formatted back trajectories associated with admissable data. For example, if numCol = 9, all admissable endpoints in the back trajectories will contain 9 columns.
printElev - if true, writes elevation data to disk while reading and loading endpoints.
progress - A graphical progress bar object may be passed; pass a null object if not needed
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

readConc

public void readConc(double incr,
                     int zone,
                     javax.swing.JProgressBar progress)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Reads correlated data and associates them with the appropriate points (tagging) on the basis of their identifiers.

Since the identifiers are dates, the input files contain a date range by which the tagging is conducted. The preconditions of the input file are checked by a call to checkInputFile()

Parameters:
incr - the temporal interval between back trajectories, in hours. REQUIRES: 24%incr = 0. (the increment evenly divides 24 hours of the day so that there are a regular number of back trajectories per day.)
zone - the time zone correction to make to the correlated data input file relative to the time zone of the back trajectories.
progress - A graphical progress bar object may be passed; pass a null object if not needed
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkInputFile

public int checkInputFile()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Verifies that the correlated data input file is formatted correctly. Returns 0 if the input data file is formatted correctly; a value greater than 0 otherwise.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

calcPSCF

public void calcPSCF(int threshMethod,
                     double percentile,
                     Triplet[] weights,
                     boolean useSourceIDs)
              throws java.lang.Exception
calculates the PSCF once all endpoints are loaded and data is tagged.

Parameters:
threshMethod - the method by which to calculate thresholds. This is used if the thresholds are not in the correlated data input file.

threshMethod = 1: use the average of each pollutant as the threshold

threshMethod = 2: use the average + 1 unit of standard deviation as the threshold

threshMethod = 3: use a percentile-based method to determine the threshold concentrations

percentile: - used only if threshMethod = 3: the percentile of the concentration data to be used as the threshold. REQUIRES: 0 < percentile <= 1.0.
weights - the weights to be used for the PSCF function. For preconditions for weights, see the World.changeWeight method.

if threshMethod is not 1, 2 or 3 and the input file does not contain threshold data, the option defaults to taking the average as a threshold

useSourceIDs - true if the weights provided pertain to the number of unique sourceIDs in a grid. Otherwise, the weights are assumed to be NIJ limits.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

calcCWT

public void calcCWT(int calcMethod,
                    double ndValue,
                    int pointFilter,
                    int polyDegree,
                    double confInt,
                    AdvancedTriplet[] weights)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Calculates a single CWT-field of this world with various options. Note: DOES NOT WRITE THE CWT-matrix to disk.

Parameters:
calcMethod - an index for selecting the type of CWT-calculation to perform

calcMethod = 1: use a basic CWT model without any enhancements

calcMethod = 2: use a logarithmic CWT model without any enhancements

calcMethod = 3: use a basic CWT model with signal smoothing

calcMethod = 4: use a logarithmic CWT model with signal smoothing

pointFilter - an odd-numbered length representing 2N+1 (the filter length), where N is the left and right bound used for data smoothing. Generally, the larger the length of the filter, the greater the smoothing effect
ndValue - the value used for representing "no Data" on the CWT grid. NOTE: ndValue should be the same as that which is specified for printing a null CWT matrices. Typically, -1.00 is used.
polyDegree - a user-defined parameter which specifies the degree of the polynomial to use smoothing with
confInt - the confidence interval (1-probability) of the desired analysis in decimal format (0.95, 0.999, etc.)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

calcRTWC

public void calcRTWC(int optionSelect,
                     double convPercent,
                     int maxIterations,
                     int pointFilter,
                     int polyDegree,
                     double confInt,
                     int ndValue,
                     AdvancedTriplet[] weights)
              throws java.lang.Exception
"Master" RTWC method which uses redistributed concentration fields based on previously calculated CWT-fields. NOTE: at least one previously calculated CWT IS A REQUIREMENT

Parameters:
varList - a list of correlated variables
optionSelect - option selection for calculation methods:

optionSelect = 1: linear CWT; no smoothing, fixed iterations (maxIterations)

optionSelect = 2: linear CWT; no smoothing, use convergence criteria % (up to a maxIteration if specified)

optionSelect = 3: add smoothing to option 2.

optionSelect = 4; add smoothing to option 1

convPercent - list the required convergence, IN PERCENT (x100). DEFAULT if <0: 1%
maxIterations - the maximum number of iterations of CWT that should be conducted. If convPercent >= 0, then maxIterations = 1000 by default.
pointFilter - an odd-numbered length representing 2N+1 (the filter length), where N is the left and right bound used for data smoothing. Generally, the larger the length of the filter, the greater the smoothing effect
ndValue - the value used for representing "no Data" on the CWT grid. NOTE: ndValue should be the same as that which is specified for printing a null CWT matrices. MUST BE LESS THAN ZERO. Typically, -1.00 is used.
polyDegree - a user-defined parameter which specifies the degree of the polynomial to use smoothing with
confInt - the confidence interval (1-probability) of the desired analysis in decimal format (0.95, 0.999, etc.)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

calcQTBA

public void calcQTBA(double a,
                     AdvancedTriplet[] weights)
Calculates the QTBA field of this Grid. Implementation Note: More options such as smoothing should be implemented.

Parameters:
a - atmospheric dispersion velocity (km/hr)
weights - triplet array for application of weights; can be null

GridMetrics

public void GridMetrics(int optionSelect)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Prints Grid Metrics specific to the type of calculation to disk.

Parameters:
optionSelect - the type of calculation performed

optionSelect = 1: PSCF, CWT, RTWC. (For every correlated variable, the tagged population is averaged and printed)

optionSelect != 1 (typically 2): QTBA (For every correlated variable, the avg. natural transport potential function (T) is averaged and printed)

Throws:
java.io.IOException
